algorithm_technique: Perform an in-order traversal of the BST to get elements in sorted order and find the minimum difference between adjacent nodes.
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest difference between any two node values in a Binary Search Tree.
problem_summary_technical: Leverage the BST property: in-order traversal yields sorted values. Track the previous node's value to find the minimum difference.
key_insights: The in-order traversal of a BST visits nodes in ascending order.
The minimum difference must occur between adjacent nodes in the sorted sequence.
Keep track of the previously visited node's value to calculate the difference.
